summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting a copy of Alfredo Rodriguez's California driver's license as part of an obstruction of justice investigation. Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, is implicated in retaining an address book believed to contain names of underage girls linked to Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez was employed by Jeffrey Epstein and is under investigation for obstruction of justice related to his retention of an address book containing names of potential underage victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of a child prostitution investigation and was previously convicted of lesser offenses in Florida state court.

persons.name: Christina J. Pryor
persons.context: Pryor drafted the electronic communication requesting Rodriguez's driver's license.

persons.name: Michael J. Donohoe
persons.context: Donohoe approved the electronic communication regarding the request for Rodriguez's driver's license.

connections.description: Rodriguez worked as a house manager and butler for Epstein, which is relevant to the investigation into Epstein's activities.
Pryor drafted the communication that Donohoe approved, indicating a direct working relationship.

events.title: Child Prostitution Investigation
events.description: An investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities began, focusing on allegations of child prostitution.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez for failing to turn over an address book to law enforcement.

events.title: Attempted Sale of Address Book
events.description: Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names of potential underage victims to an undercover agent posing as a plaintiff's attorney employee.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was a house manager and butler for Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez retained an address book believed to contain names of underage girls linked to Epstein's activities.
The FBI is investigating Rodriguez for obstruction of justice related to his failure to turn over the address book.
Epstein was previously convicted of lesser offenses in a child prostitution case in Florida.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an undercover agent in November 2009.
